definition.name: NXpolarizer_opt

symbol.name: N_spectrum
symbol.doc: Size of the wavelength array for which the refractive index of the material and/or coating is given.

symbol.name: N_spectrum_RT
symbol.doc: Size of the wavelength array for which the reflectance or transmission of the polarizer is given.

definition.doc:
An optical polarizer.
Information on the properties of polarizer is provided e.g. [here](https://www.rp-photonics.com/polarizers.html).

field.name: type
field.doc: Type of the polarizer (e.g. dichroic, linear, circular etc.)

field.name: type_other
field.doc: If you selected 'other' in type specify what it is.

group.doc: Describe the geometry (shape, dimension etc.) of the device. Specify the dimensions in 'SHAPE/size'. A sketch of the device should be provided in the 'sketch(NXdata)' field to clarify (i) the shape and dimensions of the device, and (ii) the input and outputs (i.e. the direction of the incoming and outcoming (split) beams).

field.name: shape
field.doc: Describe the shape (plate, cube, wedged, prism etc.).

field.name: other_shape
field.doc: If you chose 'other' in 'shape' describe what it is.

group.name: sketch
group.doc: Sketch of thedevice showing its geometry. The paths of the incoming and outgoing beam should be illustrated and labelled (0 for the incoming beam, and 1, 2,..., N_outputs for the outputs).

field.name: size
field.doc:
Physical extent of the device. The device might be made up of one or more objects (NX_objects). The meaning and location of the axes used will vary according to the value of the 'shape' variable. 'N_shapepar' defines how many parameters:
* For 'cube' the parameters are (width, length). * For 'cylinder' the parameters are (diameter, length). * For 'plate' the parameters are (width, height, length). * For 'prism' the parameters are (width, height, length). * For 'wedged' the parameters are (width, height, shortest length). The wedge angle should be provided in 'SHAPE/wedge_angle'. * For 'other' the parameters may be (A, B, C, ...) with the labels defined in the sketch plotted in 'SHAPE/sketch'.

field.name: wavelength_range
field.doc: Wavelength range for which the polarizer is designed. Enter the minimum and maximum wavelength (lower and upper limit) of the range.

group.name: substrate
group.doc: Properties of the substrate material of the polarizer. If the device has a coating specify the coating material and its properties in 'coating'.

field.name: substrate_material
field.doc: Specify the substrate material of the polarizer.

field.name: index_of_refraction
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the polarizer material. Specify at given spectral values (wavelength, energy, wavenumber etc.).

group.name: COATING
group.doc: If the device has a coating describe the material and its properties. Some basic information can be found e.g. [here] (https://www.opto-e.com/basics/reflection-transmission-and-coatings). If the back and front side of the polarizer are coated with different materials, you may define two coatings (e.g. COATING1 and COATING2).

field.name: coating_type
field.doc: Specify the coating type (e.g. dielectric, anti-reflection (AR), multilayer coating etc.).

field.name: index_of_refraction_coating
field.doc: Complex index of refraction of the coating. Specify at given spectral values (wavelength, energy, wavenumber etc.).

field.name: reflection
field.doc: Reflection of the polarizer at given wavelength values.

field.name: transmission
field.doc: Transmission of the polarizer at given wavelength values.
